comments:
I20061010-0800 + Plugin Export from today

Given a project JUnit containing junit3.8.1src
1. Use clean up profile from the attachment for JUnit
2. Use formatter profile from the attachment for JUnit
3. Open junit.framework.Assert
4. Clean up Assert 
5. Undo clean up
Is:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2006-10-17 15:41:27.914
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Initializing Quick Diff".
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.core.runtime.AssertionFailedException: assertion failed: 
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:109)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:95)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.texteditor.quickdiff.DocumentLineDiffer.handleChanged(DocumentLineDiffer.java:887)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.texteditor.quickdiff.DocumentLineDiffer$2.run(DocumentLineDiffer.java:661)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

Created an attachment (id=52112)
clean up profile
I cannot reproduce this. Even if I enable formatting on Clean Up or if I only format and then Undo I cannot recreate the bug using I20061017-0800.

Created an attachment (id=52205)
clean up profile

Created an attachment (id=52206)
formatter profile

(Only change to Eclipse build in profile is: Spaces only as Tab Policy
Sorry, looks like I've attached the wrong profiles... I can reproduce in I20061017-0800

The formatter profile is not correct, see Bug 161395. But when I take the attached Clean Up Profile and change the 'Eclipse built in' Formatter profile to use Spaces only then I can reproduce in a fresh I20061017-0800 workpsace. But more like 10% then 100% of the times (just do undo, redo, undo, redo....)
Seems to be a timing issue that needs to be debugged on your machine.

I also got:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.AssertionFailedException: assertion failed: 
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:109)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:95)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.texteditor.quickdiff.DocumentLineDiffer.handleChanged(DocumentLineDiffer.java:879)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.texteditor.quickdiff.DocumentLineDiffer$2.run(DocumentLineDiffer.java:656)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

using I20070116-1510.

Might occured when I overwrote some changes in the synchronize view, while I had a quickdiff open on the file I replaced.
I am not sure since this failed silently and I didn't realize immediately that I had a failure in the error log view.
*** Bug 211227 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
